purpleculture_pinyin:
shùn
Shun (c. 23rd century BC), mythical sage and leader
Сюн (ок. 23 век до н.э.), мифический мудрец и вождь
rtega_mnemonic:
舜舜RSlegendary ruler, a morning glory, rose of Sharon, Althaea
  • ruler with feet 舛 and claws 爫 ruling wide 冖 places; his palace is full of roses
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 舛 indicates the sound; 爫 (claw) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
李舜臣 [ lǐ shùn chén ]: Yi Sunshin (1545-1598), Korean admiral and folk hero, famous for sea victories over the Japanese invaders
虞舜 [ yú shùn ]: Yu Shun, one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝
舜帝陵 [ shùn dì líng ]: several tombs of legendary Emperor Shun, one in Ningyuan county 宁远县 in southwest Hunan, another Yuncheng prefecture 运城 Shanxi
舜日尧天 [ shùn rì yáo tiān ]: sage Emperors Shun and Yao rule every day (idiom); all for the best in the best of all possible worlds
舜日尧年 [ shùn rì yáo nián ]: sage Emperors Shun and Yao rule every day (idiom); all for the best in the best of all possible worlds

Ru_Meaning: type of morning glory, rose of Sharon, althea
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 瞬 (またたく、シュン мгновение) - гораздо более распространённый кандзи, этот для него фонетик.
Ru_Words: Вообще практически нигде и никак не используется, кроме имён. Даже номинальное значение толком не известно, и чаще кандзи объясняется просто как "имя древнекитайского императора Шунь". Однако судя по подробному разбору кандзи на компоненты (в частности 舛 - танцующие ноги) и связи с 瞬, значение - "быстрое движение".
Ru_Radicals: 冖 (ва), 夕 (вечер), 爪 (ноготь), 牛 (корова), 舛 (танцующие ноги)
Ru_trainchinese: shùn: (сущ) Шунь (имя мифического императора, правившего в древнем Китае ок. 2200 до н.э.)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you oppose (舛) clawing (⺤) a cover (冖) over the morning glory
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The character " Shun " on the bamboo slips of the Warring States period is transformed from " earth ", " Yun ", the human form under " Yun " or writing "大", the "大" shape is decorated with a pen, and it becomes a " fire " shape. " Shun " is the differentiated word for "夋" (Ji Xusheng). The word " jun " from "夋" means great, and also means a person with outstanding virtue. The original meaning refers to a person with outstanding ability, and the name of the ancient holy king, referring to Emperor Shun. "Di Shun" is written "Di Jun" in "Shan Hai Jing", which can be cross-referenced with the character " Shun " on bamboo slips of the Warring States Period.

" Shun " was a wise monarch in ancient times. He was born in a humble background and was promoted by Yao to become the emperor. "Guodian Jane. "Qing Da Yishi" Jane 2: "Shun cultivated in Li (Li) Mountain, pottery shot in Hepu, standing as the emperor, and met Xu (Yao)." It means that Shun cultivated in Lishan, made pottery by the river, and was Yongli became the emperor because he met Emperor Yao. "Guodian Jane. "Tao of Tang Yu" Jane 15-17: "The ancient husband Shun Qu (lives) in the grass and grass without worry, he is promoted to the emperor without Qiao (arrogant), and he (lives) in the grass without worry, Wisdom (knowledge) fate. Promoted to the emperor without Qiao (arrogance), not to flow." It means that Shun was born in a humble background, lived in the grass without suffering, promoted to the emperor without pride, and lived in the grass. Not worrying in Mao Zhong is knowing the destiny, and being promoted to the emperor without being proud is not indulging (see Liu Zhao).

" Yao " saw the virtue of " Shun ", so he gave him the throne and married his two daughters. "Guodian Jane. "The Tao of Tang Yu" Jane 22: "The ancient Yao's actions Shun Ye, fainted (sound) Shun filial piety, wisdom (knowing) he can raise the elders of the world." It means that Yao promoted Shun in ancient times. I heard that Shun was filial and knew He can raise the elderly in the world. "Guodian Jane. "Tao of Tang Yu" Jane 25: "Ancient Yao's 廛 (Zen) Yu (almost) Shun also, female (such as) this also." It means that Yao gave the Zen position to Shun in ancient times.

" Yao " and " Shun " are called the Holy King together, " Yao " means high, " Shun " means great, and "Yao and Shun's way" is the highest and greatest way of governing the country. Duan Yucai's "Shuowen Jiezi Annotation": "Those who have the posthumous title of Yu clan, Yao, Gao Ye; Shun, Da Ye. Shun, the homophone of "Jun" is a false borrowed word. "Shan Hai Jing" is "Di Jun". "

Shun can continue Yao's good governance, extend it, and benefit the people. "White Tiger Pass. Morality. Number": "Who is the Yao? Yao is still awkward, the highest appearance, clear and far away, you travel Boyan, the lord of all the sages, and the longest of the hundred kings. What is the Shun? Shun is still 僢You can believe in Yao Dao by words."

" Shun " and " Yao " are both Ming emperors. After their death, they were worshipped by the people. Today, there is a "Da Shun Temple" in Shangyu, Shaoxing City, Zhejiang Province. According to legend, Emperor Shun was born here. There is a "Shun Temple" in Jiuyi Mountain, Yongzhou City, Hunan Province, according to legend. Emperor Shun was buried here after his death.

The idiom "Concubine Shun crying bamboo" means that after Shun's death, his two concubines shed tears and blood, sprinkled them on the bamboo and stained it with spots. Therefore, the bamboo with purple-brown spots on the stem is also called "Xiang Fei bamboo."

The "Shun Song Nanfeng" refers to Shun making a five-string piano and playing the song "Southern Wind", hoping to eliminate the people's poverty, moisten people's livelihood, and enrich the people.

According to legend, " Shun " has two pupils in each eye, hence the name "Chonghua". "Historical Records. "The Book of Five Emperors": "Yu Shun, the name is Chonghua." Zhang Shoujie Zhengyi: "(Shun) has eyes with pupils, so it is called Chonghua." Later, "Chonghua" was also used as the emperor.

" Shun " is also a rare surname at present, a descendant of Emperor Shun. "A Study of Surnames": "Yu Shun's subordinate, Shun is the family." The " Shun " surname is distributed in present-day Beijing, Yuncheng in Shanxi, and Chenghai in Guangdong. South Australia and other places. During the Spring and Autumn Period, the state-owned Shanxi government official Shunhua, the Tang Dynasty had Shunhua, and the Ming Dynasty had Shun used Yu.

" Shun " later referred to the name of grass, a kind of creeping plant. Chu State called it "葍", Qin State called it "藑". It spreads on the ground and grows with flowers all over the vines. After adding "艸" to create the word "蕣", it specifically expresses the meaning of the cursive name. "Said Wen": "Yang (Shun), Jian Ye. Chu is called Zhi, Qin is called Zhi, and vine lotus. Pictogram. From 舛, 舛 also sounds. All Shun belongs to Shun. 𡐩, ancient Wenshun. " Fish " means Mujin ( mujin ), "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. "Midsummer Chronicle": "Born in Pinellia, Mu Jinrong." Gao Youu's note: "Mu Jin, the morning glory and evening fall, is the moon glory, can be used for steaming, the miscellaneous family is called the dynasty, a shackle."
humanum_short_description_en: The original meaning of " Shun " refers to a person with outstanding ability, and it is the name of an ancient emperor, referring to Emperor Shun.
humanum_full_description:
戰國竹簡「舜」字從「土」，「允」聲，「允」下的人形或寫作「大」，「大」形又加飾筆，訛成「火」形。「舜」是「夋」的分化字（季旭昇）。從「夋」的「俊」字表示大，又表示才德超卓的人。本義指才能超卓的人，又是上古聖王的名號，指帝舜。「帝舜」在《山海經》中寫作「帝俊」，與戰國竹簡「舜」字可互相參照。

　　「舜」是上古賢明的君主，他出身寒微，受到堯的提拔，立為天子。《郭店簡．窮達以時》簡2：「舜耕於鬲（歷）山，陶拍於河浦，立而為天子，遇圥（堯）也。」意謂舜在歷山耕種，在河邊製作陶器，被擁立成為天子，是因為遇到了帝堯。《郭店簡．唐虞之道》簡15-17：「夫古者舜佢（居）於草茅之中而不憂，升為天子而不喬（驕），佢（居）草茅之中而不憂，智（知）命也。升為天子而不喬（驕），不流也。」意謂古時舜出身低賤，住在草茅之中而不憂患，提升為天子而不驕傲，住在草茅之中不憂患是知道天命，升為天子而不驕傲是不放縱（參劉釗）。

　　「堯」看到「舜」的賢孝，故把王位禪讓給他，並把兩個女兒嫁給他。《郭店簡．唐虞之道》簡22：「古者堯之舉舜也，昏（聞）舜孝，智（知）其能養天下之老也。」意謂古時堯提拔舜，聽說舜孝順，知道他能養育天下的老人。《郭店簡．唐虞之道》簡25：「古堯之廛（禪）虖（乎）舜也，女（如）此也。」意謂古時堯禪位給舜，是這樣的。

　　「堯」、「舜」一同被稱為聖王，「堯」表示高，「舜」表示大，「堯舜之道」是至高至大的治國之道。段玉裁《說文解字注》：「有虞氏以爲謚者，堯，高也；舜，大也。舜者，『俊』之同音假借字。《山海經》作『帝俊』。」

　　舜能延續堯的善政，推而廣之，造福百姓。《白虎通．德論．號》：「謂之堯者何？堯猶嶤嶤也，至髙之貌，清妙髙遠，優遊博衍，衆聖之主，百王之長也。謂之舜者何？舜猶僢僢也，言能推信堯道而行之。」

　　「舜」和「堯」都是明君，死後受到萬民的膜拜，今浙江紹興市上虞有「大舜廟」，相傳帝舜在此出生；湖南省永州市九疑山有「舜廟」，相傳帝舜死後埋葬於此。

　　成語「舜妃啼竹」指舜去世後，他的兩個妃子淚盡血出，灑在竹子上，使竹子染上斑點。故莖上有紫褐色斑點的竹子，也叫「湘妃竹」。

　　而「舜歌南風」指舜製作五弦琴，彈奏〈南風〉一歌，希望消除民困，潤澤民生，物阜民豐。

　　相傳「舜」每隻眼睛有兩個瞳孔，故名叫「重華」。《史記．五帝本紀》：「虞舜者，名曰重華。」張守節正義：「（舜）目重瞳子，故曰重華。」後來「重華」亦用來代稱帝王。

　　「舜」又是現行較罕見的姓氏，是帝舜的後裔，《姓氏考略》：「虞舜之支庶，以舜為氏。」「舜」姓分布於今北京、山西之運城、廣東之澄海、南澳等地。春秋時期晉國有大夫舜華，唐代有舜化，明代有舜用禹。

　　「舜」後來又表示草名，一種蔓生植物，楚國稱它為「葍」，秦國稱它為「藑」，蔓延在地上生長，花朵遍布於蔓藤上。後加「艸」造「蕣」字，專門表示草名之義。《說文》：「䑞（舜），艸也。楚謂之葍，秦謂之藑，蔓地蓮華。象形。从舛，舛亦聲。凡舜之屬皆从舜。𡐩，古文舜。」「蕣」即木堇（木槿），《呂氏春秋．仲夏紀》：「半夏生，木堇榮。」高誘注：「木堇，朝榮暮落，是月榮華，可用作蒸，雜家謂之朝生，一名蕣。」
humanum_short_description: 「舜」的本義指才能超卓的人，又是上古帝王的名號，指帝舜。

戰國竹簡「 舜 」字從「 土 」，「 允 」聲，「 允 」下的人形或寫作「 大 」，「 大 」形又加飾筆，訛成「 火 」形。「 舜 」是「 夋 」的分化字（季旭昇）。從「 夋 」的「 俊 」字表示大，又表示才德超卓的人。本義指才能超卓的人，又是上古聖王的名號，指帝舜。「帝舜」在《山海經》中寫作「帝俊」，與戰國竹簡「 舜 」字可互相參照。 「 舜 」是上古賢明的君主，他出身寒微，受到堯的提拔，立為天子。《郭店簡．窮達以時》簡2：「舜耕於鬲（歷）山，陶拍於河浦，立而為天子，遇圥（堯）也。」意謂舜在歷山耕種，在河邊製作陶器，被擁立成為天子，是因為遇到了帝堯。《郭店簡．唐虞之道》簡15-17：「夫古者舜佢（居）於草茅之中而不憂，升為天子而不喬（驕），佢（居）草茅之中而不憂，智（知）命也。升為天子而不喬（驕），不流也。」意謂古時舜出身低賤，住在草茅之中而不憂患，提升為天子而不驕傲，住在草茅之中不憂患是知道天命，升為天子而不驕傲是不放縱（參劉釗）。 「 堯 」看到「 舜 」的賢孝，故把王位禪讓給他，並把兩個女兒嫁給他。《郭店簡．唐虞之道》簡22：「古者堯之舉舜也，昏（聞）舜孝，智（知）其能養天下之老也。」意謂古時堯提拔舜，聽說舜孝順，知道他能養育天下的老人。《郭店簡．唐虞之道》簡25：「古堯之廛（禪）虖（乎）舜也，女（如）此也。」意謂古時堯禪位給舜，是這樣的。 「 堯 」、「 舜 」一同被稱為聖王，「 堯 」表示高，「 舜 」表示大，「堯舜之道」是至高至大的治國之道。段玉裁《說文解字注》：「有虞氏以爲謚者，堯，高也；舜，大也。舜者，『俊』之同音假借字。《山海經》作『帝俊』。」 舜能延續堯的善政，推而廣之，造福百姓。《白虎通．德論．號》：「謂之堯者何？堯猶嶤嶤也，至髙之貌，清妙髙遠，優遊博衍，衆聖之主，百王之長也。謂之舜者何？舜猶僢僢也，言能推信堯道而行之。」 「 舜 」和「 堯 」都是明君，死後受到萬民的膜拜，今浙江紹興市上虞有「大舜廟」，相傳帝舜在此出生；湖南省永州市九疑山有「舜廟」，相傳帝舜死後埋葬於此。 成語「舜妃啼竹」指舜去世後，他的兩個妃子淚盡血出，灑在竹子上，使竹子染上斑點。故莖上有紫褐色斑點的竹子，也叫「湘妃竹」。 而「舜歌南風」指舜製作五弦琴，彈奏〈南風〉一歌，希望消除民困，潤澤民生，物阜民豐。 相傳「 舜 」每隻眼睛有兩個瞳孔，故名叫「重華」。《史記．五帝本紀》：「虞舜者，名曰重華。」張守節正義：「（舜）目重瞳子，故曰重華。」後來「重華」亦用來代稱帝王。 「 舜 」又是現行較罕見的姓氏，是帝舜的後裔，《姓氏考略》：「虞舜之支庶，以舜為氏。」「 舜 」姓分布於今北京、山西之運城、廣東之澄海、南澳等地。春秋時期晉國有大夫舜華，唐代有舜化，明代有舜用禹。 「 舜 」後來又表示草名，一種蔓生植物，楚國稱它為「 葍 」，秦國稱它為「 藑 」，蔓延在地上生長，花朵遍布於蔓藤上。後加「 艸 」造「 蕣 」字，專門表示草名之義。《說文》：「䑞（舜），艸也。楚謂之葍，秦謂之藑，蔓地蓮華。象形。从舛，舛亦聲。凡舜之屬皆从舜。𡐩，古文舜。」「 蕣 」即木堇（木槿），《呂氏春秋．仲夏紀》：「半夏生，木堇榮。」高誘注：「木堇，朝榮暮落，是月榮華，可用作蒸，雜家謂之朝生，一名蕣。」
Elaboration: The character " Shun" on the bamboo slips of the Warring States period is transformed from " earth", " Yun", the human form under " Yun" or writing " 大", the " 大" shape is decorated with a pen, and it becomes a " fire" shape. " Shun" is the differentiated word for " 夋" (Ji Xusheng). The word " jun" from " 夋" means great, and also means a person with outstanding virtue. The original meaning refers to a person with outstanding ability, and the name of the ancient holy king, referring to Emperor Shun. "Di Shun" is written "Di Jun" in "Shan Hai Jing", which can be cross-referenced with the character " Shun" on bamboo slips of the Warring States Period. " Shun" was a wise monarch in ancient times. He was born in a humble background and was promoted by Yao to become the emperor. "Guodian Jane. "Qing Da Yishi" Jane 2: "Shun cultivated in Li (Li) Mountain, pottery shot in Hepu, standing as the emperor, and met Xu (Yao)." It means that Shun cultivated in Lishan, made pottery by the river, and was Yongli became the emperor because he met Emperor Yao. "Guodian Jane. "Tao of Tang Yu" Jane 15-17: "The ancient husband Shun Qu (lives) in the grass and grass without worry, he is promoted to the emperor without Qiao (arrogant), and he (lives) in the grass without worry, Wisdom (knowledge) fate. Promoted to the emperor without Qiao (arrogance), not to flow." It means that Shun was born in a humble background, lived in the grass without suffering, promoted to the emperor without pride, and lived in the grass. Not worrying in Mao Zhong is knowing the destiny, and being promoted to the emperor without being proud is not indulging (see Liu Zhao). " Yao" saw the virtue of" Shun", so he gave him the throne and married his two daughters. "Guodian Jane. "The Tao of Tang Yu" Jane 22: "The ancient Yao's actions Shun Ye, fainted (sound) Shun filial piety, wisdom (knowing) he can raise the elders of the world." It means that Yao promoted Shun in ancient times. I heard that Shun was filial and knew He can raise the elderly in the world. "Guodian Jane. "Tao of Tang Yu" Jane 25: "Ancient Yao's 廛 (Zen) Yu (almost) Shun also, female (such as) this also." It means that Yao gave the Zen position to Shun in ancient times. " Yao" and " Shun" are called the Holy King together, " Yao" means high, " Shun" means great, and "Yao and Shun's way" is the highest and greatest way of governing the country. Duan Yucai's "Shuowen Jiezi Annotation": "Those who have the posthumous title of Yu clan, Yao, Gao Ye; Shun, Da Ye. Shun, the homophone of "Jun" is a false borrowed word. "Shan Hai Jing" is "Di Jun". " Shun can continue Yao's good governance, extend it, and benefit the people. "White Tiger Pass. Morality. Number": "Who is the Yao? Yao is still awkward, the highest appearance, clear and far away, you travel Boyan, the lord of all the sages, and the longest of the hundred kings. What is the Shun? Shun is still 僢You can believe in Yao Dao by words." " Shun" and " Yao" are both Ming emperors. After their death, they were worshipped by the people. Today, there is a "Da Shun Temple" in Shangyu, Shaoxing City, Zhejiang Province. According to legend, Emperor Shun was born here. There is a "Shun Temple" in Jiuyi Mountain, Yongzhou City, Hunan Province, according to legend. Emperor Shun was buried here after his death. The idiom "Concubine Shun crying bamboo" means that after Shun's death, his two concubines shed tears and blood, sprinkled them on the bamboo and stained it with spots. Therefore, the bamboo with purple-brown spots on the stem is also called "Xiang Fei bamboo." The "Shun Song Nanfeng" refers to Shun making a five-string piano and playing the song "Southern Wind", hoping to eliminate the people's poverty, moisten people's livelihood, and enrich the people. According to legend, " Shun" has two pupils in each eye, hence the name "Chonghua". "Historical Records. "The Book of Five Emperors": "Yu Shun, the name is Chonghua." Zhang Shoujie Zhengyi: "(Shun) has eyes with pupils, so it is called Chonghua." Later, "Chonghua" was also used as the emperor. " Shun" is also a rare surname at present, a descendant of Emperor Shun. "A Study of Surnames": "Yu Shun's subordinate, Shun is the family." The " Shun" surname is distributed in present-day Beijing, Yuncheng in Shanxi, and Chenghai in Guangdong. South Australia and other places. During the Spring and Autumn Period, the state-owned Shanxi government official Shunhua, the Tang Dynasty had Shunhua, and the Ming Dynasty had Shun used Yu. " Shun" later referred to the name of grass, a kind of creeping plant. Chu State called it " 葍", Qin State called it " 藑". It spreads on the ground and grows with flowers all over the vines. After adding " 艸" to create the word " 蕣", it specifically expresses the meaning of the cursive name. "Said Wen": "Yang (Shun), Jian Ye. Chu is called Zhi, Qin is called Zhi, and vine lotus. Pictogram. From 舛, 舛 also sounds. All Shun belongs to Shun. 𡐩, ancient Wenshun. " Fish" means Mujin ( mujin), "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. "Midsummer Chronicle": "Born in Pinellia, Mu Jinrong." Gao Youu's note: "Mu Jin, the morning glory and evening fall, is the moon glory, can be used for steaming, the miscellaneous family is called the dynasty, a shackle."

舜字的基本解释

舜
shùn
传说中的上古帝王：尧舜（传说均是上古的贤明君主，后泛指圣人）。尧天舜日（喻太平盛世）。
“木槿”的别称：颜如舜华（喻女子容貌美丽）。

舜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shùn］
［《廣韻》舒閏切，去稕，書。］
“俊2”的被通假字。
(1)植物名。木槿。参见“舜華”。
(2)人名。五帝之一，传说中我国父系氏族社会后期部落联盟的贤明首领。姚姓，有虞氏，名重华，史称虞舜或舜。相传受尧禅让，后禅位于禹，死在苍梧。参阅《书·尧典》、《史记·五帝本纪》。
(3)姓。春秋晋时有舜华。见《史记·孔子世家》。

舜字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【舛字部】　舜； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1008第10
〔古文〕???【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?輸閏切，音蕣。【說文】草也。楚謂之葍，秦謂之藑，蔓地連華。又【詩·鄭風】有女同車，顏如舜華。【傳】舜，木槿也。　又有虞氏之號。【史記·五帝紀】虞舜者，名曰重華。【註】駰按：諡法曰：仁聖盛明曰舜。　又姓。見【姓譜】。

舜字的源字形

舜字的起名意思

：古代圣明君王的名字。也是“木槿”的别称，指女子容貌美丽，如颜如舜华。又如舜华，舜英，指木槿花。

Shun
Basic explanation of words
Shun
shùn
The legendary ancient emperor: Yao Shun (the legends are all ancient wise monarchs, later referred to as saints). Yaotian and Shunri (Yu Taiping and Prosperity).
Another name for "mujin": Yan Rushunhua (Yu woman has a beautiful appearance).
Shun
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shùn］
["Guangyun" Shu Run cuts, goes to 稕, book. ]
"Jun 2" was passed falsely.
(1) Plant name. Hibiscus. See "Shun Hua".
(2) The name of the person. One of the five emperors, the legendary wise leader of the tribal alliance in the late period of our patrilineal clan society. Yao's surname has the Yu family, and his name is Chonghua. His name is Yu Shun or Shun in history. According to legend, after Yao's surrender, the latter was located in Yu and died in Cangwu. See "Shu Yaodian", "Historical Records: The Book of Five Emperors".
(3) Last name. There was Shunhua in the Spring and Autumn Period. See "Historical Records·Confucius Family".

Shun
Source glyph
Shun
Name meaning
: The name of the ancient Shengming King. It is also another name for "mujin", referring to women with beautiful appearance, such as Yan Ru Shunhua. Another example is Shunhua and Shunying, referring to Mujinhua.
舜
会意字。篆书从医,表示叶、蔓、花相连之形;从舛,表示枝叶交错蔓延。本义是草名,一种蔓生植物。古文献中用作上古
帝王名。
传说中的上古帝王名:尧天~日(尧、舜均为古代圣君贤
主,比喻升平盛世)。

冖 (ва), 夕 (вечер), 爪 (ноготь), 牛 (корова), 舛 (танцующие ноги)
Не путать: 瞬 (またたく、シュン мгновение) - гораздо более распространённый кандзи, этот для него фонетик.
Вообще практически нигде и никак не используется, кроме имён. Даже номинальное значение толком не известно, и чаще кандзи объясняется просто как "имя древнекитайского императора Шунь". Однако судя по подробному разбору кандзи на компоненты (в частности 舛 - танцующие ноги) и связи с 瞬, значение - "быстрое движение".
